result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 124 days credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Attend Domestic Violence counseling.
No contact with the victim or her residence.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to be given 124 days credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 1

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Jury status hearing on October 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James A Allen in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy J Guza.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Inmate Communication letter; advising the Court that he will be seeking legal action on what happen in Court with the DA on7/27/15
Hearing on August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 9:16 am.
Defendant James A Allen in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy J Guza.    
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Guza moves for a new date because he has not received discovery. 
Attorney Guza moves to have the bond hearing reheard. State is not prepared to hear a bond hearing today. 
Court hears the bond modification request. Attorney Guza moves for a signature bond. 
Court passes the case for Attorney Guza to contact Attorney Osborne. 
Case recalled at 10:12 am.  Attorney Guza was able to contact attorney Osborne.  Law intern makes statements, objects to modification of bail.
Defendant does not have a criminal record.  
The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
inmate communication letter; requesting a bail reduction
inmate communication letter dated 6/25/15; requesting a bail reduction
Inmate Communication letter received on 6/22; requesting a bail reduction and an early court date.
Hearing on July 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James A Allen in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy J Guza.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Brian Ratzlaff was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects to bind over and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defense counsel presents bail motion arguments. State objects to any modification and presents arguments. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed. Bail can be readdressed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
